Changed the editor to grow with content instead of staying fixed-height, which fixes large images getting cut by the bottom of the editor.

### What I changed
- In `src/app/components/Editor.tsx`, updated the editor container classes:
  - from `h-[calc(100vh-190px)] min-h-[360px]`
  - to `min-h-[calc(100vh-190px)]`

That keeps a viewport-sized starting height but allows the editor to expand vertically as images (or any content) are inserted.

### Why this fixes it
- A fixed `h-[...]` constrained the content area.
- Using only `min-h-[...]` preserves the initial layout while removing the hard cap, so inserted images can push the editor down naturally.

### Quick verify
- Insert a tall image in the editor.
- Confirm the white editor panel extends downward instead of clipping/splitting at the bottom boundary.

---

The current behavior is happening because image deletion is still relying on **native `contentEditable` backspace behavior**, and your inserted images are treated as non-editable atomic blocks.

The key parts in `src/app/components/Editor.tsx` are:

```246:276:src/app/components/Editor.tsx
// Create a wrapper div for the image
const wrapper = window.document.createElement('div');
wrapper.contentEditable = 'false';
wrapper.style.margin = '1rem 0';
wrapper.appendChild(img);

range.insertNode(wrapper);
...
const newPara = window.document.createElement('div');
newPara.innerHTML = '<br>';
wrapper.parentNode?.insertBefore(newPara, wrapper.nextSibling);
```

Why this causes the issue:
- `wrapper.contentEditable = 'false'` makes each image block non-editable/atomic.
- When images end up adjacent (or effectively adjacent), browsers often treat contiguous non-editable blocks as one deletion unit.
- There is no custom `Backspace` handler for image nodes, so the browser decides deletion behavior.
- Google Docs does **not** rely on raw browser default behavior here; it uses a custom document model + custom key handling to delete exactly one object at a time.

So the short answer: this is a `contentEditable` edge case caused by non-editable wrappers and lack of explicit keyboard deletion logic for image nodes.  

If you want, I can implement the Google-Docs-like fix next by intercepting `Backspace` at caret boundaries and deleting only the immediately previous image wrapper.

Implemented a Google-Docs-like backspace behavior for adjacent images in `src/app/components/Editor.tsx`.

What changed:
- Added a custom `Backspace` handler in `handleKeyDown` that:
  - Detects if the caret is directly after an image wrapper in the editor root, **or**
  - At the beginning of a text block whose previous sibling is an image wrapper.
- When detected, it prevents default browser deletion and removes **only that single preceding image wrapper**.
- Marks document as changed and updates formatting state after deletion.

Why this should fix your case:
- Before, browser-native `contentEditable` deletion could treat adjacent non-editable image blocks as a combined deletion unit.
- Now deletion is explicit and scoped to exactly one previous image block, matching the behavior you described (cursor after second image + backspace deletes only second image).

Quick test:
1. Insert two images one after another.
2. Place caret immediately after the second image.
3. Press backspace once.
4. Only the second image should be removed; the first should remain.

If you want, I can also add symmetric `Delete`-key behavior (forward delete of the next image) to make navigation/editing feel even closer to Docs.

GlossaDocs\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nGlossaDocs is a browser-based document editor inspired by Google Docs, with a product focus on better multilingual writing workflows.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe current codebase is a working local-first UI prototype with rich text editing, document storage in the browser, and language-aware UX foundations.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## What The Project Is\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nGlossaDocs aims to make multilingual writing feel native instead of bolted on. The core concept is:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- Let users choose language intent per document.\\\\\\\\n- Build toward integrated non-Latin input methods (starting with Russian in planned stories).\\\\\\\\n- Preserve a familiar docs-style experience (document list, editor, autosave, export/import).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Current Implementation (In This Repo)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- Rich text editor built on &#96;contentEditable&#96; with formatting controls:\\\\\\\\n  - Bold, italic, underline\\\\\\\\n  - Font size, alignment, and line spacing\\\\\\\\n  - Image insertion (PNG/JPEG, with size cycling)\\\\\\\\n- Document management UI:\\\\\\\\n  - Create new document\\\\\\\\n  - Open existing document\\\\\\\\n  - Delete document\\\\\\\\n  - Edit document title\\\\\\\\n- Persistence:\\\\\\\\n  - Browser IndexedDB storage (&#96;GlossaDocs&#96; database)\\\\\\\\n  - Auto-save after 10 seconds of unsaved changes\\\\\\\\n  - Manual save button and saved/unsaved status indicators\\\\\\\\n- Import/Export:\\\\\\\\n  - Import &#96;.txt&#96; and &#96;.docx&#96;\\\\\\\\n  - Export &#96;.txt&#96;, &#96;.docx&#96;, and &#96;.pdf&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Language support (current UI):\\\\\\\\n  - Per-document language selector for &#96;en&#96;, &#96;de&#96;, &#96;ru&#96;\\\\\\\\n  - Direction handling scaffold exists for future RTL languages\\\\\\\\n- Auth state:\\\\\\\\n  - Login/guest flow is currently simulated with local storage placeholders (no real backend auth yet)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Tech Stack\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- React + TypeScript\\\\\\\\n- Vite\\\\\\\\n- IndexedDB for local document persistence\\\\\\\\n- UI libraries: MUI, Radix, Tailwind ecosystem utilities\\\\\\\\n- File conversion/export libraries:\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;mammoth&#96; for &#96;.docx&#96; import\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;docx&#96; and &#96;jspdf&#96; for export\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Running Locally\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. Install dependencies:\\\\\\\\n   - &#96;npm install&#96;\\\\\\\\n2. Start the dev server:\\\\\\\\n   - &#96;npm run dev&#96;\\\\\\\\n3. Open in browser:\\\\\\\\n   - &#96;http://localhost:5173/&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNote: this repo is configured to run Vite with host exposure so local browser access works from &#96;npm run dev&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Current Limitations\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- No backend or real authentication yet.\\\\\\\\n- No collaboration/sharing yet.\\\\\\\\n- Language features are in progress; current language selection is foundational, with advanced input-method behavior planned.\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":65}\\\",\\\"toolCallBinary\\\":\\\"\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"8f64a84c-d3ce-4532-b7a5-4d84379b459f\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"23aa0028-0b35-4636-99a7-11145366c788\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"cursorCommands\\\":[],\\\"cursorCommandsExplicitlySet\\\":false,\\\"pastChats\\\":[],\\\"pastChatsExplicitlySet\\\":false,\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-03-01T0 ---

Current gaps I can confirm from code (WCAG 2.0 + responsive behavior):

- **High — images have no text alternative** (`src/app/components/Editor.tsx`)  
  New images are created without an `alt` attribute, which fails **WCAG 2.0 1.1.1 (Non-text Content)**.

- **High — image resize is mouse-only** (`src/app/components/Editor.tsx`)  
  Resize is bound to image `click` only, with no keyboard equivalent, which fails **WCAG 2.0 2.1.1 (Keyboard)**.

- **High — document card semantics are wrong for an interactive control** (`src/app/components/DocumentCard.tsx`)  
  The card is keyboard-focusable and triggers open on Enter/Space, but it is exposed as `role="listitem"` instead of an interactive role/element. That’s a **WCAG 2.0 4.1.2 (Name, Role, Value)** issue.

- **High — nested keyboard interaction conflict in document cards** (`src/app/components/DocumentCard.tsx`)  
  The card handles Space/Enter globally while containing a delete `<button>`. Keyboard events from the delete button can bubble and trigger card open unexpectedly (unexpected behavior for keyboard users), impacting **2.1.1 (Keyboard)** and predictable interaction.

- **Medium risk — color contrast likely insufficient in some UI text/icons** (`src/app/components/EditorToolbar.tsx`, `src/app/components/DocumentCard.tsx`, `src/app/components/Login.tsx`)  
  Multiple `text-gray-500/600` on light backgrounds and small status text/icons may fail **1.4.3 (Contrast Minimum)**, but this needs measured contrast checks to confirm.

- **Medium risk — login error handling is toast-first, not field-associated** (`src/app/components/Login.tsx`)  
  Errors are shown as toast but not attached to specific fields (`aria-invalid`, `aria-describedby`), which is a likely miss for **3.3.1 (Error Identification)** in some AT flows.

Responsive/common screen-size problems I can confirm:

- **Toolbar relies on horizontal scrolling on small screens** (`src/app/components/EditorToolbar.tsx`)  
  Formatting controls are in an `overflow-x-auto` row with `min-w-max`, so controls can be off-screen and hard to discover on phones.

- **Editor viewport sizing still uses `vh` math** (`src/app/components/Editor.tsx`)  
  `min-h-[calc(100vh-190px)]` can behave poorly with mobile browser chrome (address bar show/hide), causing unstable editor height on iOS/Android.

- **Keyboard panel only becomes side-by-side at `xl`** (`src/app/components/Editor.tsx`)  
  Two-column editor+keyboard layout waits until very wide screens; many tablets/laptops stay single-column, which hurts usability on common mid-size screens.

If you want, I can do the next pass as a **fix plan ordered by impact/effort** and then start implementing from the top (I’d start with: image `alt`, keyboard-accessible image resize, and document card semantics/keyboard conflict).

---

Implemented a prioritized accessibility plan and started with the highest-impact fixes while preserving existing behavior.

## Fix Plan (prioritized)

- **P0: Editor image accessibility**
  - Add text alternatives for inserted images.
  - Make image resize operable by keyboard (Enter/Space), not just mouse click.
  - Keep existing click-to-cycle sizing behavior unchanged.

- **P0: Keyboard interaction correctness in document list**
  - Ensure document cards expose interactive semantics properly.
  - Prevent nested keyboard conflicts so delete actions don’t trigger “open document.”

- **P1: Accessible deletion confirmation**
  - Replace native `confirm()` with an accessible dialog that supports focus management and screen readers.
  - Preserve same delete/cancel behavior.

- **P1: Status/error announcement improvements**
  - Improve save/unsaved status announcements and field-level login error semantics.

- **P2: Responsive WCAG improvements**
  - Reduce reliance on horizontal-scroll toolbar on small screens.
  - Replace `vh`-based editor sizing with mobile-safe viewport handling (`dvh` strategy).

## What I changed now (most important issues)

- **`src/app/components/Editor.tsx`**
  - Added `alt` text for inserted images (derived from file name, fallback to “Inserted image”).
  - Made inserted images keyboard focusable and operable:
    - `tabIndex=0`
    - `role="button"`
    - Enter/Space now trigger the same resize cycle as click.
  - Preserved existing click resize cycle (25/50/75/100%).

- **`src/app/components/DocumentCard.tsx`**
  - Updated card semantics from non-interactive list item behavior to interactive behavior (`role="button"`).
  - Kept Enter/Space open behavior.
  - Prevented keyboard event conflicts by ignoring key events originating from child controls (like Delete button), so deleting won’t also open the document.

- **`src/app/components/DocumentList.tsx`**
  - Replaced native `confirm()` with `AlertDialog`-based confirmation.
  - Added explicit delete state handling (`pendingDeleteId`, dialog open state, deleting state).
  - Preserved behavior: user still confirms before deletion, and list reloads after delete.

## Next recommended pass

- Improve save/unsaved live-region messaging in `EditorToolbar`.
- Add field-associated login error messaging in `Login`.
- Make editor/container sizing and toolbar controls more robust across small/mobile screens.

If you want, I’ll continue immediately with that next pass.

---

Implemented the next accessibility/responsive pass while preserving existing behavior.

### What I changed

- **Improved save-state announcements** in `src/app/components/EditorToolbar.tsx`
  - `Unsaved/Saved` status is now visible on all screen sizes (not hidden on mobile).
  - Added stronger live-region semantics (`aria-live`, `aria-atomic`, explicit `aria-label`) so status updates are announced more reliably.
  - Slightly increased muted text contrast (`text-gray-600` / `text-green-700`) for readability.

- **Made toolbar controls more discoverable on small screens** in `src/app/components/EditorToolbar.tsx`
  - Replaced horizontal-scroll-only toolbar behavior with wrapping layout on mobile.
  - Keeps all formatting controls, but avoids controls being hidden off-screen.

- **Added field-level accessible login errors** in `src/app/components/Login.tsx`
  - Added `formErrors` state for username/password/general auth failures.
  - Inputs now use `aria-invalid` and `aria-describedby` when errors exist.
  - Rendered inline error messages with `role="alert"` (and polite live region for general login errors).
  - Preserved existing toast messages and login flow.

- **Improved common-screen-size behavior for editor layout** in `src/app/components/Editor.tsx`
  - Root editor page now uses `min-h-screen min-h-[100dvh]` for better mobile viewport handling.
  - Editor canvas uses `min-h-[calc(100vh-190px)]` plus `min-h-[calc(100dvh-190px)]`.
  - Keyboard sidebar two-column layout/sticky behavior now starts at `lg` instead of only `xl`.

### Notes

- Lint check shows only the same pre-existing `Editor.tsx` TypeScript issues (the React JSX typing + existing keyboard/language type warnings).  
- No new lints were introduced in `EditorToolbar.tsx` or `Login.tsx`.

If you want, next I can do a focused pass on **contrast hardening** (strict WCAG 2.0 AA color pairs) and **touch target sizing** (44x44 on mobile).

---

## Findings Before PR (Prioritized)

### High severity
- **Autosave debounce is tied to a boolean, not edit activity** in `src/app/hooks/useAutoSave.ts` and `src/app/components/Editor.tsx`.
  - Once `hasUnsavedChanges` becomes `true`, the timer starts and won’t reset on each keystroke, so save can trigger while the user is still actively typing.
  - Pre-PR impact: unexpected saves / churn and harder-to-reason editor state.

- **Raw HTML hydration/import path is unsafe/brittle** in `src/app/components/Editor.tsx` and `src/app/utils/import.ts`.
  - Content is persisted and restored via `innerHTML`, and imported DOCX HTML is minimally transformed before storage.
  - Pre-PR impact: malformed imported HTML can break layout; long-term security risk if this ever becomes non-local content.

### Medium severity
- **Image interaction logic isn’t reusable or durable** in `src/app/components/Editor.tsx`.
  - Per-image event listeners are attached at insertion time; behavior won’t exist for previously saved images unless reinstrumented after load.
  - Pre-PR impact: inconsistent behavior across “fresh insert” vs “reopened doc.”

- **Type-safety bypass in language select** in `src/app/components/EditorToolbar.tsx`.
  - `onValueChange={onLanguageChange as (value: string) => void}` masks a type mismatch instead of handling it.
  - Pre-PR impact: invalid language values can slip in silently.

- **Duplicated file validation logic** in `src/app/components/DocumentList.tsx` vs `src/app/utils/import.ts`.
  - `DocumentList` manually checks extensions even though `isSupportedDocumentFile` already exists.
  - Pre-PR impact: drift risk and duplicate maintenance.

- **Interactive card pattern is semantically awkward** in `src/app/components/DocumentCard.tsx`.
  - Entire card acts like a button while containing an actual delete button.
  - Pre-PR impact: edge-case keyboard/screen-reader ambiguity despite your recent safeguards.

### Low severity
- **Dead import** in `src/app/components/Login.tsx`: `GreekDecoration` is imported but unused.
- **Unused constants/helpers and weak typing**:
  - `UI_CONSTANTS.MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_MB`, `MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES`, `IMAGE_SIZES` in `src/app/utils/constants.ts` are not consistently reused where relevant.
  - `getNextImageSize` in `src/app/utils/dom.ts` appears underused.
  - `isBlockLevelTag` uses `as any` in `src/app/utils/dom.ts`.

---

## Best Code-Reuse Opportunities

- **Centralize image behavior**: one helper for creation + sizing + ARIA attributes (instead of inline setup in `Editor.tsx`).
- **Centralize file validation**: use `isSupportedDocumentFile` in `DocumentList.tsx` and keep error text in one place.
- **Use existing constants everywhere**: replace hardcoded `5 * 1024 * 1024` and size-cycle arrays with `UI_CONSTANTS`.
- **Unify language typing**: make `Document.language` in `src/app/utils/db.ts` use the shared `Language` type instead of a duplicated union.

---

## Quick Wins (Do These First)

- Remove unused `GreekDecoration` import.
- Replace manual extension check in `DocumentList.tsx` with `isSupportedDocumentFile`.
- Replace hardcoded image size/limit values in `Editor.tsx` with `UI_CONSTANTS`.
- Remove `as any` in `isBlockLevelTag` and fix the language select cast properly.

## Larger Refactors (Post-PR or separate PR)

- Rework autosave to debounce on edit events/timestamps rather than `hasUnsavedChanges` boolean transitions.
- Add a sanitize/normalize boundary for imported/restored HTML.
- Move image interaction to delegated editor-level handlers so behavior survives rehydration.

If you want, I can start a **cleanup-only PR prep patch** now with the quick wins (no behavior changes).

Completed the cleanup pass with reuse-focused changes and no behavior changes to core flows.

### What I cleaned up

- **Removed dead import**
  - `src/app/components/Login.tsx`
  - Removed unused `GreekDecoration` import.

- **Reused existing file validation helper**
  - `src/app/components/DocumentList.tsx`
  - Switched from manual extension checks to `isSupportedDocumentFile()` from `src/app/utils/import.ts`.

- **Reused shared constants/utilities for image sizing**
  - `src/app/components/Editor.tsx`
  - Replaced hardcoded max image size with `UI_CONSTANTS.MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES`.
  - Replaced inline image size-cycle logic with `getNextImageSize(..., UI_CONSTANTS.IMAGE_SIZES)`.

- **Removed weak typing pattern**
  - `src/app/utils/dom.ts`
  - Replaced `as any` in `isBlockLevelTag()` with a typed `some(...)` check.

- **Removed unsafe language cast in toolbar**
  - `src/app/components/EditorToolbar.tsx`
  - `src/app/utils/languages.ts`
  - Added `isLanguage()` type guard and used it in toolbar `onValueChange`, removing the casted callback.

### Notes

- I did **not** change larger behavior-sensitive areas yet (autosave design, HTML sanitization pipeline, editor architecture), since those are bigger refactors.
- This pass is safe for pre-PR hygiene and reduces duplication/typing risk.

If you want, next I can do a second cleanup pass for the remaining “medium” items that are still low-risk before merge (e.g., shared import error message constants and minor editor helper extraction).

Fixed in `src/app/components/Editor.tsx` by removing the impossible language comparisons:

- Replaced:
  - `document?.language === 'ar' || document?.language === 'he' ? 'rtl' : 'ltr'`
- With:
  - `const languageDir: 'ltr' | 'rtl' = 'ltr';`

### Verification
- Re-ran lints for `Editor.tsx`.
- The `"types ... and 'ar' have no overlap"` error is resolved.
- Only one unrelated pre-existing lint remains (`isComposing` typing).

### Why this fixes it
`document.language` is typed as `'en' | 'de' | 'ru'`, so comparing it to `'ar'`/`'he'` is statically impossible. Setting direction explicitly to `ltr` for currently supported languages removes that invalid comparison.
